Every day, over 950 Americans die from mental illness - directly or indirectly. In Illinois, one person dies by suicide every six hours. As the largest mental health reform bill in 50 years, it addresses critical flaws in our nation’s broken mental health system and focuses on providing treatment and evidence-based reform. Today, this important bill sits in the Senate, awaiting action that we as a nation desperately need. Stay aware, and remember that asking for help is NEVER a sign of weakness.

Last night, we also passed the CHAMPION Act, which extends funding for Community Health Centers, like Crusader Health in Rockford and Mendota Health and Wellness Center, as well as programs like the Special Diabetes Program, and Teaching Health Center Graduate Medical Education Program.
